intro: Suaeda heteroptera var. tenuiramea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea blite, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that help retain water in arid conditions. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline soils, showcasing its tolerance to high salinity. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. This species plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
